Diversity is one of the most important features of a healthy ecosystem. It also creates more unique flavours, supports local food traditions and creates a more beautiful landscape üôÇ

pages.subtitle: A simple way to support diversity is cooking (plant-based) meals with lots of different colors!

pages.title: Lower biodiversity can increase the risk of‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
When the diversity of animals and plants goes down - for example replacing forest with a monoculture - it makes it harder for ‚Äòspecialists‚Äô (species depending on specific plants or ecosystems) to survive and ‚Äògeneralist‚Äô animals like rats thrive. These animals often carry dangerous viruses and as nature's own regulation of diseases is 'broken' it becomes easier for a virus to spread to humans.

Coming up with false answers for this question was really hard because biodiversity improves almost everything!
answerExplanation.title: ü¶†

dailyContent.notificationText: The damage of chemical fertilizer¬†‚ò†Ô∏è¬†- Recipe of the day: Sweet Potato and Beetroot Tart

home.title: The damage of chemical fertilizer

pages.title: Chemical fertilizer can boost the growth of crops in the short-term üå±
But it ‚Äòborrows‚Äô this productivity from the future because it damages the soil¬†‚ò†Ô∏è. And that‚Äôs not the only issue.
Chemical fertilizer‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
We often hear about the emissions of food transportation, but fertilizer causes more than double the emissions.

It costs an enormous amount of energy to manufacture fertilizer. And when it is spread on the field, micro-organisms in the soil convert it to laughing gas, adding even more emissions.

Often farmers also use too much fertilizer, which creates serious water pollution.

pages.subtitle: Like we‚Äôve seen before, legumes are good for the soil. Here we use hummus as the ‚Äòsoil‚Äô of these delicious tarts.

pages.hometitle: How can we reduce the climate impact of fertilizer?
pages.title: Chemical fertilizer is not all bad and a little less than half of all people on Earth are dependent on it¬†üåç
The main problem is that we often use too much. But there are solutions¬†‚ú®
In a big 10-year-long experiment, Chinese farmers were able to increase yields while using LESS fertilizer¬†üåæ
How did they achieve this?

answerExplanation.text:
By training farmers, they increased the yield of corn, rice, and wheat while reducing fertilizer use. This reduced the climate impact by 14-22%!

For example, they helped to improve the timing when crops are planted and instead of applying fertilizer all at once, doing it in two smaller batches.
answerExplanation.title: üë®üèº‚Äçüåæ

dailyContent.notificationText: How a ‚Äòwater footprint‚Äô works¬†üí¶¬†- Recipe of the day: Minty Aubergine Wraps

home.title: How a ‚Äòwater footprint‚Äô works

pages.title: The water we use for showers or irrigation comes from rivers, lakes or underground storage. It‚Äôs called ‚Äòblue water‚Äô¬†üöø
For agriculture, we also need to take a look at ‚Äògreen water‚Äô¬†üí¶
What is green water?

answerOptions.title: Water used to dissolve polluting particles¬†‚ò†Ô∏è
Water stored in the soil through rainfall¬†üåß

answerExplanation.text:
Blue water is directly taken from rivers, lakes, or underground storage. This is the water used for showers or irrigation.

Agriculture has another large ‚Äòhidden‚Äô aspect of water that also matters: green water. This is stored in the soil through rainfall. Together they create the water footprint of a food product.

pages.subtitle: Avocados are very thirsty plants so we wanted to create delicious wraps without the need for avocado.

pages.hometitle: Why should we care how much rainwater a food product requires?
pages.title: So if green water mostly comes from rain, why should we care about it?¬†üåß
Products with a low green water footprint are more sustainable because:

answerOptions.title: It decreases the risk of droughts ‚òÄÔ∏è

answerExplanation.text:
The majority of our food is produced with rain. But climate change makes the weather more extreme, so relying on rain becomes more unpredictable.

And if it doesn‚Äôt rain, you still need 2170 liters of water to grow the grass and corn for a steak. So unless you use more blue water there is no steak. This is why ‚Äògreen water‚Äô matters and why eating foods with a lower water footprint is more sustainable.
answerExplanation.title: üåß

dailyContent.notificationText: The footprint of tomatoes in winter¬†üçÖ¬†-¬†Recipe of the day: Chickpea Tajine with Peaches

home.title: The footprint of tomatoes in winter

pages.title: Tomatoes are the most popular vegetable in Europe¬†üçÖ. They‚Äôre a summer vegetable, but you can now buy them year-round.
There are several ways in which supermarkets offer tomatoes during cold winter months¬†‚ùÑÔ∏è
What type of ‚Äòwinter tomato‚Äô has the highest footprint?

answerExplanation.text:
Of course, seasonal food is the best option. But during winter months, canned food is also a good option. Canned tomatoes are harvested during summer. In the can they remain fresh anda are often tastier than tomatoes from a greenhouse.

It‚Äôs easy to feel decision stress with all these options. Just keep in mind: eating fewer animal products is more important than buying the most sustainable tomato.

pages.subtitle: These canned ingredients help to create a delicious meal around the celeriac, a ‚Äòforgotten‚Äô vegetable for the winter months.

pages.hometitle: What are the benefits of canned tomatoes?
pages.title: Cans can be recycled endlessly but this process costs a lot of energy ‚ö°Ô∏è
But there are some other benefits to canned tomatoes¬†ü•´
What is a benefit of canned tomatoes?

answerExplanation.text:
Canned tomatoes have a lower waste because compared to fresh tomatoes there is less waste in our own kitchens. In both cases, there is quite some waste that happens at the farming stage. In total, 54% of fresh tomatoes are wasted, and 41% of canned tomatoes.

Another benefit of canned tomatoes is that they are processed right after harvest, so they retain more nutrients than transported fresh tomatoes.
answerExplanation.title: ü•´

dailyContent.notificationText: How legumes improve the soil ü´ò - Recipe of the day: Sweet Potato and Lentil Curry

home.title: How legumes improve the soil

pages.title: By now you‚Äôve seen that legumes are great for the climate ü´ò Let‚Äôs find out how exactly that works.
What makes the roots of legumes special?

answerOptions.title: They allow the soil to store more water¬†üí¶
They add nitrogen to the soil ‚ö°Ô∏è

answerExplanation.text:
Nitrogen is a key ingredient for plants. Instead of only using nitrogen, legumes also ADD it to the soil. This happens through a ‚Äòpartnership‚Äô with bacteria that like to live around their roots.

This means that farmers can use legumes instead of nitrogen fertilizer, which saves emissions and has lots of other benefits.

pages.subtitle: A delicious curry with lentils to improve the soil!

pages.hometitle: How can we increase the potential of legumes even more?
pages.title: When a farmer uses beans in the field, he needs less fertilizer to grow wheat¬†ü´ò
There is a special farming method that boosts the special power of legumes even more¬†üßëüèº‚Äçüåæ
How can we increase the potential of legumes?¬†ü´ò
pages.subtitle: to fix nitrogen in the soil

answerOptions.title: Growing beans and wheat together in one field

answerExplanation.text:
This method of growing different plants in one field at the same time is called intercropping. It boosts the power of legumes, saves land, and also looks more beautiful than a monoculture.

Using intercropping for all legumes could reduce the need for chemical fertilizer by 26%. This is a big deal because (as you discovered a few stories back) fertilizer has a big climate impact!
answerExplanation.title: ü´ò

dailyContent.notificationText: There are millions of pigs in the Netherlands. Where are they?¬†üê∑¬†- Recipe of the day: Vegetable Jambalaya

home.title: Hidden pigs

pages.title: The Netherlands uses a star system to show the wellbeing of animals. A meat product can have 0-3 stars ‚≠êÔ∏è
Only the pigs with 2 or 3 stars live in a stable where they can go outside¬†üê∑
How many of the pigs in the Netherlands never come outside?¬†

answerExplanation.text:
Unfortunately it is very difficult to find 2-3 star pork. The animal welfare of pigs is a serious issue.

We often see cows in the fields, while pigs are hidden out of sight. You never see them, even though there are way more pigs than cows in the Netherlands and the EU.

pages.subtitle: Smoked paprika powder is an excellent way to replace the taste of bacon of other meat.

pages.hometitle: How many of the chickens see daylight in the Netherlands?
pages.title: How many of the broiler chickens for Dutch supermarkets see daylight?¬†üêì
pages.subtitle: broiler chickens are raised for meat

answerExplanation.text:
Since 2023, all chicken meat in Dutch supermarkets has at least 1 star. And chickens with a 1-star rating can go outside (unlike 1-star pigs). They are also a breed that grows slower.

A lot of work still needs to be done, for example, 0-star chicken that grows faster than is healthy for the chicken still exists in the Netherlands for export. But this success shows that campaigns for animal welfare work!

All the credit goes to Wakker Dier which started campaigning in 2013 (!). Read their story in the link.
answerExplanation.title: üåü

dailyContent.notificationText: What is organic farming? üë©‚Äçüåæ¬†- Recipe of the day: Red Cabbage Stir-fry

home.title: What is organic farming?

pages.title: Organic food is not just a label but also a mindset. ü§ì
To better understand organic farming, we need to compare it with industrial agriculture.
What is industrial agriculture?

answerOptions.title: Using chemicals to grow the most food possible üß™
Creating bigger farms to save money üí∞

answerExplanation.text:
Industrial agriculture is all about output: getting more food from the land, by any means necessary. This made food production very efficient but it‚Äôs also destroying the soil we depend on.

Organic agriculture is about keeping a balance between healthy soil and food production. That‚Äôs why it uses crop rotations, manure, and compost.

pages.subtitle: A recipe with apples, one of the products it‚Äôs easy to buy the organic version.

pages.hometitle: How big is organic farming in the EU?
pages.title: 10% of all farmland in the EU is organic¬†üë®üèª‚Äçüåæ
What is the EU goal for 2030?¬†üá™üá∫
pages.subtitle: for the share of organic agriculture

answerExplanation.text:
The good news is that organic agriculture is on the rise in the EU and the US.

The bad news: at the current rate the EU won‚Äôt reach its target. Austria is the only country that already reached it. In the US, organic agriculture is less than 1% of all farmland.

Buying more organic products helps the transition. Start with one or two products that you always buy organically. Read more about our take on our blog.
answerExplanation.title: üá™üá∫

dailyContent.notificationText: What does sustainable coffee look like? ‚òïÔ∏è - Recipe of the day: White Wine Mushroom Tagliatelle

home.title: What does sustainable coffee look like?

pages.title: Coffee and cacao plants and trees originally grow in the shade of the forest üå≥
But to increase production, many farms now grow coffee or cacao directly in the sun ‚òÄÔ∏è
That means forest is cut down to make space for the plantations ü™ì One of the solutions is ‚Äòagroforestry‚Äô.
What does sustainable coffee look like?

answerOptions.title: Cutting trees in a sustainable way

answerExplanation.text:
Agroforestry is mixing food production with forest. That makes it possible to turn coffee plantations into forests. The quality also improves because there is more shade.

The best way to find these products is to look for high-quality, single-origin coffee or chocolate. It‚Äôs more transparent where it comes from and often more sustainable and fair.

pages.subtitle: This recipe includes walnuts. And since those come from trees, they can also come from agroforestry systems.

pages.title: The coffee example is known as ‚Äòmultistrata agroforestry‚Äô¬†üå≥¬†It‚Äôs an important climate solution in Project Drawdown
There are also other forms of agroforestry that can save lots of CO2¬†‚¨áÔ∏è
What type of agroforestry is most common in Europe?

answerExplanation.text:
‚ÄòSilvopasture‚Äô is an ancient farming method where animals graze between trees. The most common form is the Spanish dehesa, where animals live between oak trees. It‚Äôs also possible to combine animals or even vegetable production with nut, fruit, or olive trees.

If silvopasture replaces intensive grasslands it is another important climate solution with lots of benefits: healthier soils, shade for the animals, and more beautiful landscapes!
answerExplanation.title: üêÑ

dailyContent.notificationText: Here are some easy ways to add extra protein üí™¬†- Recipe of the day: Celeriac Sweet Potato Mash

home.title: The easiest way to add more protein

pages.title: Nuts and legumes are a great source of protein ü´òü•ú¬†
Especially because you can easily add them to any meal.
Which food has the most protein? üí™
pages.subtitle: per 100 g

answerExplanation.text:
We already discovered that most people worry too much about protein. But if you eat completely plant-based, it is useful to know which foods add protein to your meal.

A hand full of pumpkin or sunflower seeds is a great way to add some extra protein. They also provide a tasty crunch to any meal, from yogurt to rice and pasta.

pages.subtitle: The pumpkin seeds in this recipe provide some extra protein and crunch.

pages.hometitle: Nuts contain a lot of fat. How healthy is that?
pages.title: Nuts might have a lot of protein but they also have a lot of fat¬†ü•ú
Fats come in two forms: saturated (bad) and unsaturated (good)¬†ü§ì
What contains the least amount of saturated (bad) fat?

answerExplanation.text:
A typical portion size of nuts has less saturated fat than a typical serving of meat or dairy.

Nuts contain a lot of fat but these are mostly unsaturated. This means that nuts have many health benefits. They reduce cholesterol and the risk of type 2 diabetes and heart disease. Studies also didn‚Äôt find a connection to weight gain. And of course they‚Äôre delicious ü§§

The EAT Lancet report recommends 50 g a day!
answerExplanation.title: ü•ú

dailyContent.notificationText: The story of farmed fish üêü¬†- Recipe of the day: Mushroom Ginger Noodle Soup

home.title: The story of farmed fish

pages.title: Before humans started farming, we hunted wild animals for meat üèπ. This caused the extinction of many big mammals like the mammoth.
Fishing is like hunting üé£. And because of that, many fish are endangered. As a solution - like we did with animals on the land - we started fish farms.
What do farmed fish and farmed meat have in common? üêüüêñ

answerOptions.title: It requires land to grow their feed

answerExplanation.text:
Farmed fish causes the same problems as farmed meat: it takes lots of land to feed them. Sometimes farms even catch wild fish to use as feed. Overall it‚Äôs the same problem in water as on land: we want to eat products that require a lot of feed.

Instead, we need to eat lower-impact foods. Nuts and legumes from the land. Mussels, smaller fish like herring, and seaweed from the ocean.

pages.subtitle: Farmed fish are fed with soy. Better to eat it ourselves, like in this recipe, where we use tofu.

pages.hometitle: Is most of our fish wild or farmed?
pages.title: What provides more seafood?¬†üç£
pages.subtitle: for humans

answerExplanation.text:
53% of the world‚Äôs seafood comes from fish farms. In 1960 it was only 6%. Because of this, more soy is now used to feed fish than to create tofu!

Catching fish in the wild and farming fish creates different kinds of issues. What applies to both contexts is that we need to switch to seafood with a lower footprint: small fish from the wild and mussels and seaweed from farms.
answerExplanation.title: üêü

dailyContent.notificationText: The impact of organic food üå±¬†- Recipe of the day: Caponata

home.title: The impact of organic food

pages.title: A French¬†study¬†showed that organic products decrease your carbon footprint. But there is a twist.
Organic food only reduces your footprint if you also‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
Organic farming has lots of benefits but there is one downside: it requires a bit more land. So if we want to keep eating the same amount of meat, we would have to use even more land to grow the animal feed.

The solution is eating less meat and dairy. This frees up lots of farmland we can then use for organic agriculture.

pages.subtitle: Wheat products usually require a lot of chemical fertilizer, so buying organic pasta is a great choice.

pages.hometitle: Is organic meat better for the climate?
pages.title: The carbon footprint of organic meat is‚Ä¶¬†ü•©
pages.subtitle: on average, compared to conventional meat

answerExplanation.text:
Meat from organic farms might have benefits, for example, it‚Äôs usually much better for the animals. But one thing is clear in the data: it doesn‚Äôt necessarily have a lower carbon footprint.

Once again we can conclude that WHAT you eat is much more important than HOW it is produced.
answerExplanation.title: ü•©

dailyContent.notificationText: What‚Äôs the impact of using soy cream?¬†üêÑ¬†- Recipe of the day: Creamy Pear Pasta

home.title: What‚Äôs the impact of using soy cream?

pages.title: Maybe you‚Äôve noticed that we mention ‚Äò(soy)cream‚Äô in our recipes.
It means that we leave the choice up to you: use soy cream or dairy cream¬†üêÑ
But we started wondering: what‚Äôs the difference? So we calculated the impact for our ‚ÄòCreamy Pear Pasta‚Äô¬†üçù
Replacing dairy cream with soy cream saves the same CO2 emissions as‚Ä¶

answerOptions.title: Leaving out the pasta¬†üçù¬†(520 g CO2)
Leaving out the pears¬†üçê¬†(280 g CO2)

answerExplanation.text:
Cooking with 250 ml soy cream instead of dairy cream cancels out the footprint of 400 grams of pasta! That is more than we thought.

If you can‚Äôt find it in your local store, don‚Äôt feel too bad. But for anyone who wants to do their best, cooking with plant-based cream is a step worth taking.

pages.subtitle: You can also use other plant-based cooking cream, but we like soy cream the most.

pages.hometitle: How healthy is soy cream?
pages.title: We recently found out that soy cream is made with sunflower oil‚Ä¶¬†üåª¬†Does that make it unhealthy?
Which type of cream contains less saturated fat?

answerExplanation.text:
Cream is about adding fat, taste, and creaminess. It‚Äôs usually not the healthiest product.

But soy cream, even though it‚Äôs made with sunflower oil, is a healthier option than most dairy cream. It has a MUCH lower amount of saturated fat (2g compared to 12-19g). It also has fewer calories.
answerExplanation.title: üåª

dailyContent.notificationText: What Europe needs to do about palm oil¬†üå¥¬†- Recipe of the day: Indonesian Spicy Cabbage

home.title: What Europe needs to do about palm oil

pages.title: As we discovered in the ‚ÄòFading Forest‚Äô, palm oil is a big cause of deforestation¬†ü™ì
While most palm oil is used as cooking oil in Asia, Europe also imports 20% of the world‚Äôs palm oil¬†üå¥
Where is most palm oil used in the EU?

answerExplanation.text:
The majority of palm oil in the EU is used as biofuel. The good news is that it will be phased out by 2030. Still, the question is what it will be replaced with.

Here we have to draw a conclusion that‚Äôs not about food: ride your bike or take public transport more than a car!

pages.subtitle: A tribute to Indonesia, where most palm oil comes from.

pages.hometitle: Is there a sustainable form of biofuel?
pages.title: Cutting down rainforests to grow palm oil as fuel for cars or airplanes is a terrible idea¬†ü™ì
But there is also a sustainable form of biofuel: used cooking oil from frying food üçü
What is the biggest issue with used cooking oil as fuel?¬†‚úàÔ∏è

answerOptions.title: It creates less CO2 but more air pollution
It makes the engine less efficient

answerExplanation.text:
Flying from London to New York requires about 1 bathtub of fuel¬†per passenger! If you use all the cooking oil from every McDonald's in London for a whole year, it doesn‚Äôt even cover 0,1% of the yearly flights from London to New York.

There is nowhere near enough used cooking oil. Unfortunately, sustainable flying just isn‚Äôt possible. Maybe we can have electric airplanes in the future, but that is very very far away‚Ä¶
answerExplanation.title: üõÅ

dailyContent.notificationText: What you should know about water pollution¬†‚ò†Ô∏è¬†- Recipe of the day: Thai Peanut Curry

home.title: Dead zones in the water

pages.title: Today we‚Äôre going to look at ‚Äòeutrophication‚Äô. It‚Äôs a process where rivers, lakes and the ocean become polluted¬†üåä
It starts when water has too many nutrients. This causes the growth of algae at the surface and blocks sunlight¬†ü¶†
In the end, plants and fish suffocate and die¬†‚ò†Ô∏è
Where do the polluting nutrients come from?

answerExplanation.text:
In Europe and the US, most of the pollution comes from agriculture. In other regions it also comes from wastewater.

The products with the highest pollution are meat and dairy. That‚Äôs because their feed requires so much fertilizer. And because of the high-energy feed, their poop is then also full of extra nutrients and causes pollution.

pages.subtitle: The best way to reduce water pollution is eating more plant-based. Curries are always a great option!

pages.hometitle: What happened to the world‚Äôs biggest dead zone?
pages.title: One of the biggest dead zones in the world was created in the Black Sea in the 1990s¬†‚ò†Ô∏è
What happened since then?¬†üíß

answerExplanation.text:
One report identified 415 areas with eutrophication problems (and many regions don‚Äôt even have enough data). Of all those areas, only 13 are in recovery. Today the biggest dead zone is in the EU: the Baltic Sea.

But it‚Äôs hopeful that the recovery of a dead zone is possible within 15-20 years if we take the right actions.
answerExplanation.title: üíß

dailyContent.notificationText: The unfair price of rice¬†üçö¬†-¬†Recipe of the day: Fennel Risotto

home.title: The unfair price of rice

pages.title: Many of the products we enjoy in Europe come from tropical countries. Often, those farmers and workers don‚Äôt get paid enough¬†üë®üèæ‚Äçüåæ
For example, a rice farmer in Thailand only gets 56% of what they need to make a decent living¬†üí∏
The average price for white rice in the Netherlands is ‚Ç¨ 1.69 per kg¬†üçö¬†If the farmer gets paid a fair amount, how much would it increase the price?
How much would the price increase?¬†üçö
pages.subtitle: to provide a decent living standard, assuming that rice costs ‚Ç¨ 1.69 per kg

answerExplanation.text:
Farmers and workers of many products get significanlty underpaid. But it wouldn‚Äôt actually cost much to fix this problem.

To better understand why this happens, we need to explore where most of the money ends up. That‚Äôs for the next story in Fair Fields.

pages.subtitle: Arborio rice for risotto doesn‚Äôt come from Thailand, but from Italy.

pages.hometitle: What exactly is the purpose of ‚ÄòFairtrade‚Äô?
pages.title: The goal of the Fairtrade label is to tackle unfair price differences¬†üí∞¬†How does it work?
Fairtrade determines‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
Fairtrade only ensures that farmers get paid a fair price. It‚Äôs up to retailers to determine the price that consumers pay for a product. So Fairtrade is not automatically a good deal for consumers, but it is a better deal for farmers. We‚Äôll explore how exactly Fairtrade works for farmers in a later story.

And how does the Fairtrade organization make money? Products that use the Fairtrade logo pay a licensing fee. For rice in the Netherlands, this is 0,09‚Ç¨ per kg.
answerExplanation.title: üí∏

dailyContent.notificationText: Which food would not exist without pollinators?¬†üåº¬†- Recipe of the day: Beetroot and Pumpkin Curry

home.title: The pollinator team

pages.title: Many plants rely on insects to spread their pollen and reproduce üåº
Bees are the most famous pollinators but lots of other insects like butterflies and flies are also part of the team¬†ü¶ã
Which food would not exist without pollinators?

answerExplanation.text:
The good news is that the foods we eat most of - rice, wheat, and potatoes - are not dependent on pollinators. But a lot of the foods that make life better are dependent: from apples to chocolate.

That is one of the many reasons why it‚Äôs important to care for the pollinator team.

pages.subtitle: Pumpkin is another product that wouldn‚Äôt exist without pollinators.

pages.hometitle: What is the most effective way to help pollinators in your garden?
pages.title: What can you do yourself to increase pollinators in your own backyard?¬†ü¶ã
The results from lots of studies are mixed üßê¬†But there are few things that always help.
What helps pollinators the most?¬†üåº

answerExplanation.text:
A higher diversity of plant species always increased pollinators. The results were not as clear for native vs exotic plants.

Three other things consistently showed positive effects: increasing the size of the garden, having more shrubs and trees, and more exposure to the sun.
answerExplanation.title: ü¶ã

dailyContent.notificationText: The only downside of nuts¬†ü•ú¬†- Recipe of the day: Garlic Lime Spaghetti

home.title: The only downside of nuts

pages.title: We‚Äôve seen that nuts are full of protein and have a much lower footprint than meat¬†ü•ú
But when it comes to water use, they‚Äôre in the same category as beef‚Ä¶¬†üíß
Which nuts have the lowest water footprint?

answerExplanation.text:
Peanuts and walnuts use the least water. But it‚Äôs true that especially almonds, cashews, and pistachios are very thirsty plants. This is a problem in dry areas.

At the same time, nuts score MUCH better than meat on all other environmental issues. That means they are still a good source of protein in the transition to a more sustainable food system.

pages.subtitle: Peanuts have the lowest water footprint of nuts. They usually work well in rice recipes, but here they are a great fit for this pasta.

pages.hometitle: What‚Äôs the most sustainable nut if we look at all factors?
pages.title: One study wanted to find out: how can we buy responsible nuts?¬†ü•ú
They scored nuts and seeds on sustainability, but also on nutritional value and social aspects like worker safety üë∑üèΩ
Which factor is most important for the sustainability of nuts?

answerOptions.title: Amount of protein in the nut¬†üí™

answerExplanation.text:
The biggest influence on all factors was the type of nut. They divided them into three categories and walnuts and sunflower seeds scored the best in all aspects. We quickly analyzed our own recipes after learning this and good news: we use walnuts most often!

Peanuts and hazelnuts belong to the second category. Cashews, almonds, and chestnuts have the most issues. We have quite some recipes with cashews so we‚Äôll pay attention to this when making new recipes.

Replacing meat with nuts is an important part of a sustainable diet and we don‚Äôt think you should feel guilty about eating cashews or almonds. But let‚Äôs focus on eating more walnuts.
answerExplanation.title: ü•ú

dailyContent.notificationText: The footprint of home delivery¬†üè†¬†- Recipe of the day: Creamy Cabbage Potato Mash

home.title: The footprint of home delivery

pages.title: Imagine you‚Äôve found a really nice farm shop in your area that sells organic vegetables¬†üë©‚Äçüåæ
You can buy their veggie box at the shop but they can also send it to your house¬†üì¶
If the farm shop is 4 km away, which option has a lower footprint?
pages.subtitle: assuming both drive on petrol

answerExplanation.text:
Maybe you missed the answer option of taking the bike or walking? It‚Äôs definitely the most low impact way, but it was not included in the research (so we didn‚Äôt include it here). As we discovered before, food miles have a much lower footprint than people think. But there is one case where every mile matters: when you‚Äôre driving yourself! Because that‚Äôs a lot of emissions and traffic for only one delivery, compared to a truck full of veggie boxes.

At Fork Ranger, we don‚Äôt believe that everything should be delivered 24/7. More convenience is not the solution to a sustainable world. But if the alternative is driving a car, delivery is usually the better option.

pages.subtitle: Even though food miles are not a useful measure, buying local food is still important for other reasons. This recipe uses lots of ingredients from the Netherlands.

pages.hometitle: Eating locally: what is the biggest benefit for farmers?
pages.title: We found a study that summarizes a lot of research about local food systems, like farmers‚Äô markets¬†üë©üèΩ‚Äçüåæ
What is the main reason for farmers to participate in local food initiatives?

answerExplanation.text:
Often social recognition and contact with consumers was the main reason for farmers to get involved in local food initiatives.

Another interesting finding was that consumers are healthier when they buy food locally. Not because local food is healthier, but probably because they are more aware of what they eat.

Overall you might say that the main benefit of local food is being more mindful about our food, feeling connected to where it comes from, and appreciating who grew it.
answerExplanation.title: üòå

dailyContent.notificationText: How to get enough vitamin B12¬†‚ú®¬†- Recipe of the day: Carrot Cauliflower Biryani

home.title: How to get enough vitamin B12

pages.title: There is one nutrient that‚Äôs difficult to get with only plants: vitamin B12¬†‚ú®
The EAT-Lancet report calculated what a healthy and sustainable diet should look like. Overall, it‚Äôs about eating lots of veggies, legumes, and nuts¬†ü•¶ü•ú
But meat and dairy also play a role and provide the recommended amount of B12¬†ü•õ
What is the recommended amount of dairy per day?¬†ü•õ
pages.subtitle: according to the EAT-Lancet report

answerExplanation.text:
If you eat according to the EAT Lancet diet, you should get enough vitamin B12. Many plant-based meats and dairy alternatives also contain B12.

If you eat less meat & dairy than this, it‚Äôs important to pay attention and consider a Vitamin B12 supplement.

pages.subtitle: Of all dairy products, yogurt has the lowest footprint. And in this recipe it‚Äôs a delicious addition!

pages.hometitle: Where does vitamin B12 come from?
pages.title: Let‚Äôs take a closer look at where vitamin B12 comes from¬†‚ú®
Vitamin B12 is created by‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
B12 can only be made by microbes like bacteria. Sometimes plants or fungi contain B12 because they work together with bacteria, but the amounts are very low. The meat from many animals (chickens, pigs, fish) contains B12 because they eat other things that contain B12.

The microbes that create B12 also live inside the stomachs of ruminants like cows, which is why their meat and dairy contain B12.
answerExplanation.title: ü¶†

dailyContent.notificationText: The plastic dilemma, can you do something about it?¬†ü•§¬†- Recipe of the day: Fennel Orange Couscous

home.title: The plastic dilemma

pages.title: We already covered that packaging is usually a small part of the climate impact of food¬†ü•´¬†But if you want to do something about it, what can you do?¬†
We were really frustrated researching this‚Ä¶ the packaging industry is messed up! ü´ô
For example, we all know about plastic pollution, but plastic also has benefits¬†ü•§
What is the benefit of plastic packaging?

answerExplanation.text:
It‚Äôs confusing and frustrating to solve the packaging dilemmas as a consumer. The future solution is saying goodbye to single-use packaging: reusing bottles and taking your bags and boxes with you. But living this way is almost impossible in our current world.

So our advice is to avoid packaging where you can. Not to become 100% zero waste, but as a way of unlearning the convenience that single-use packaging brings. Start with bread: we buy it regularly and in many supermarkets it‚Äôs possible to put it in a reusable bag.

pages.subtitle: This is a recipe with little packaging because fennel, oranges, and zucchini are usually not wrapped in plastic.

pages.hometitle: Is plastic pollution in Europe more under control than in China?
pages.title: Most of the plastic waste that enters the Ocean comes from China¬†üá®üá≥
China‚Äôs lost plastic waste is almost 10 times higher than in Europe¬†üá™üá∫¬†But what about microplastics?
Compared to China, how much microplastics enter the Ocean from Europe?

answerExplanation.text:
In Europe and the US, we have pretty advanced waste treatment, which prevents most of the plastic pollution from entering the environment. But our microplastic pollution is on the same level as China.

When we talk about plastic pollution we often think of packaging, but in Europe, almost half the pollution comes from microplastics from other sources like washing synthetic clothing and wear and tear of car tires.
answerExplanation.title: üõû

dailyContent.notificationText: Which food provides the most Vitamin B12?¬†üíä¬†- Recipe of the day: Nasi Goreng

home.title: Which food provides the most Vitamin B12?

pages.title: B12 is a vitamin you can only get from animal foods üêê But not all animal foods contain the same amount‚Ä¶
Which food provides the most Vitamin B12?
pages.subtitle: for the same weight

answerExplanation.text:
Salmon contains by far the most B12, and it also has a lower footprint than dairy and other meat. That makes it the most climate-friendly way to fill up your B12 levels.

Eggs and dairy also have a relatively high amount of B12 for a low footprint. Beef has even more B12 but also a much higher footprint. Pork contains very little B12.

Good to know: often plant-based meat and dairy alternatives also contain B12.

pages.subtitle: Serve this Nasi Goreng with an egg for a good addition of vitamin B12.

pages.hometitle: How much vitamin B12 is in meat alternatives?
pages.title: A Dutch report compared the nutritional value of meat alternatives to meat¬†üçî
Often meat alternatives are enriched with vitamins and minerals like iron¬†‚ú®
How many of the meat replacements were enriched with vitamin B12?

answerExplanation.text:
Those 55% that were enriched had relatively high levels of B12. But since not all products are enriched, it can be tricky to get enough B12 when you only rely on meat alternatives.

ProVeg - the NGO that did the research - advises to take B12 supplements when eating (mostly) plant-based.
answerExplanation.title: üçî

dailyContent.notificationText: How animal feed can be sustainable¬†üê∑¬†- Recipe of the day: Easy Pesto Lasagne

home.title: How animal feed can be sustainable

pages.title: The main problem with animals in the food system at the moment is that we use valuable land to grow food for them¬†üåΩ
But there are also ways that meat can be sustainable. That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre going to explore in The Good Ranch.
How can animals be part of a sustainable food system?¬†üê∑
pages.subtitle: They...

answerOptions.title: ... eat plants that are toxic for humans

answerExplanation.text:
There are many by-products from food processing. For example, when making sunflower oil you are left with a dry ‚Äòcake‚Äô that we can‚Äôt eat but is nutritious feed for animals.

Another important role that especially pigs can play is eating food waste (although it‚Äôs always more effective to first eat leftover food ourselves).

pages.subtitle: Choose whole grain lasagne: there are a lot of by-products from milling white flour that are fed to animals. But it‚Äôs a lot more sustainable to eat the entire grain of wheat ourselves.

pages.hometitle: What makes up the majority of byproducts that are fed to animals?
pages.title: The majority of feed from byproducts comes from‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
The byproducts that become animal feed come from many different sources but the biggest one is grains.

Using byproducts for animal feed makes sense if they are inedible for humans. But this is not always the case.

The majority of these grain byproducts come from milling whole grain into refined grain. This is seen as a ‚Äòbyproduct‚Äô but you could also see it as food waste because whole grain products have a lot more nutrition that we can eat ourselves.
answerExplanation.title: üçû

dailyContent.notificationText: Where does most of the money go?¬†üí∞¬†- Recipe of the day: Cauliflower Oven Pasta

home.title: Where does most of the money go?

pages.title: When we buy food, most of the money goes to supermarkets while many farmers don‚Äôt get paid enough¬†üõí
After supermarkets, where does most of the money go?

answerExplanation.text:
For every euro or dollar we spend on food, 78 cents goes to big corporations. We were surprised by the high share for seed and fertilizer companies. These are the companies that have lots of lobbyists and are promoting ‚Äòefficient farming‚Äô with pesticides and special seeds.

Because of this unequal distribution, paying farmers a fair amount wouldn‚Äôt increase the end price of many products that much.

pages.subtitle: The supermarket is super convenient, but let‚Äôs try to buy our veggies from a smaller shop or market from time to time.

pages.hometitle: What‚Äôs the profit that farmers and supermarkets make?
pages.title: The previous infographic shows where the money goes but it doesn‚Äôt include costs and profit¬†üí∞
A report in the UK dug into this. For example, they found that the profit that supermarkets make on apples is only 1%¬†üçé
What‚Äôs the profit of the farmer?¬†üßëüèº‚Äçüåæ

answerExplanation.text:
The supermarket, farmer, and distributor all make a very low profit on fresh produce like apples. But while supermarkets can make a profit by selling other items, the farmers face a much bigger risk. Again, paying farmers a fair price wouldn‚Äôt increase the end price that much.

What can you do? Try to shop at smaller, organic shops from time to time. The report concludes that organic apples and carrots, sold at alternative markets, provide farmers with a much higher profit.
answerExplanation.title: üçé

dailyContent.notificationText: The footprint of plant-based meat¬†üçî¬†- Recipe of the day: Pita breads with Mushrooms

home.title: The footprint of plant-based meat

pages.title: There are more and more plant-based alternatives for meat and they definitely have a lower footprint¬†üçî
But how do they compare to the other plant-based sources of protein? ü´ò
Compared to legumes, the climate footprint of plant-based meat is‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text: Plant-based meat has half the footprint of chicken. Legumes and nuts have an even lower footprint but plant-based meat is a great solution for some of our favorite snacks, like hamburgers or hot dogs.

pages.subtitle: Mushrooms are a great way to replace the taste of meat but for these pita breads you could also use plant-based shoarma.

pages.hometitle: Which processed foods increase the risk of cancer?
pages.title: A large research found that people who eat more ultra-processed foods have a higher chance of cancer and other diseases¬†‚ò†Ô∏è
This was especially true for processed meat ü•ì
Which other processed product increased the risk of cancer?

answerExplanation.text:
Plant-based alternatives are not associated with cancer, but processed meat is. A plant-based alternative is almost certainly healthier than processed meat like a schnitzel, sausage, bacon, salami, or fast-food burger.

Most plant-based alternatives have fewer calories and less saturated fat. They also don‚Äôt contain a lot of added sugars. If you want to choose a healthy plant-based option, look at the salt content: it should be 1,1 g or less (per 100g).
answerExplanation.title: ü•ì

dailyContent.notificationText: The new normal of flying insects¬†üêù¬†- Recipe of the day: One-pot Lentil Rice

home.title: The new normal of flying insects

pages.title: Because of climate change, pesticides, and other issues, the whole community of flying insects is in trouble¬†üêù
A study in Germany found that the number of flying insects decreased even in protected areas¬†ü¶ã
How much did flying insects decrease?
pages.subtitle: total biomass in the past 27 years in protected areas in Germany

answerExplanation.text:
27 years is a very short time, but not in the life of a human. If you‚Äôre born in the 90s (like us), you don‚Äôt even know what the ‚Äònormal‚Äô amount of insects feels like. That makes it difficult to compare and feel the extreme changes.

The decrease of insects is a serious issue for food production but also for wildlife. One way to help them: take a patch of garden and leave it alone. Just let nature do its thing!

pages.subtitle: The cashews we use in this recipe would no longer exist if we lose all pollinating insects.

pages.hometitle: Can improving a small patch of greenery make a difference for insects?
pages.title: In 2016, scientists in Melbourne counted insects on a small patch of green surrounded by roads and high buildings¬†üåÜ
It was no larger than a tennis court and had some grass and two trees¬†üå≥
Then they transformed it with new soil and added 12 native plant species¬†üåø
What happened after one year?

answerExplanation.text:
After only one year, there were already 5 times more insect species. After 3 years, three of the plant species had died but still, insect species had increased 7-fold.

If you can influence a small area of land - in your own garden or together with others - it can make a big difference for insects.
answerExplanation.title: üêû

dailyContent.notificationText: Cows with two ‚Äòlives‚Äô¬†üêÑ¬†- Recipe of the day: Sweet Potato Mash with Sauerkraut

home.title: Cows with two ‚Äòlives‚Äô

pages.title: There are two ways to get beef: from cows that are specifically held for meat. Or from dairy cows that no longer give milk¬†üêÑ
Meat from dairy cows has a much lower footprint, but there is a downside.
What‚Äôs the downside of meat from dairy cows?

answerOptions.title: You can‚Äôt get a steak from it¬†ü•©

answerExplanation.text:
Meat from dairy cows has a lower footprint, but you can‚Äôt get the luxury cuts like a steak. We‚Äôre often cherry-picking the best cuts of meat which only come from beef cows. If we want to have more sustainable meat, we also need to eat the other parts, for example sausage, minced meat, and chewy meats.

If you still want to eat beef, go to a butcher and ask for meat from ‚Äòdual purpose‚Äô cows. These are breeds of cows that give both high-quality milk and beef. They are healthier cows but also rare, because they are seen as less productive.

pages.subtitle: Sauerkraut works really well with sausages‚Ä¶ but this sauerkraut recipe is also delicious without any meat!

pages.hometitle: Are traditional cow breeds more sustainable?
pages.title: Today most cows are specialized: either they are for milk OR beef¬†production¬†üêÑ
But there are also traditional all-round cow breeds that are specialized for a specific ecosystem¬†üåø
Compared to special dairy cows, these all-round cows‚Ä¶

answerOptions.title: Need to eat soy to produce enough milk ü•õ

answerExplanation.text:
Many traditional breeds produce less milk but have other benefits: they only require grass (instead of also needing soy) and can survive outside all winter.

Often, these cows also help with promoting biodiversity. For example, there is a specific type of cow that is perfect for maintaining heathland. They eat just the right type of plants and also spread seeds in their fur.
answerExplanation.title: üçÄ

dailyContent.notificationText: Gas vs. induction¬†üç≥¬†- Recipe of the day: Zucchini Peach Wraps

home.title: Gas vs. induction

pages.title: It‚Äôs time to take a look at the energy we use in our own home for cooking food.
Cooking on gas causes about 75 kg CO2 per year. How much is it with induction?
pages.subtitle: with current numbers from the Netherlands

answerExplanation.text: Right now the saved emissions are very little because most electricity is generated with fossil fuel. But even when the electricity comes from renewable sources, it‚Äôs much more important to look at what we eat. The average Dutch diet has a footprint of around 1300 kg CO2e per person.

pages.subtitle: We love induction cooking, but if you have a gas stove: place wraps directly on the flame for 20-30 seconds and make them really delicious.

pages.hometitle: What is another benefit of cooking on induction?
pages.title: While we were researching this topic we found another interesting benefit of induction¬†üëÄ
What is less likely when cooking on induction?
pages.subtitle: compared to gas

answerExplanation.text:
Cooking on gas causes indoor air pollution. A study found that children living in households that use gas stoves for cooking are¬†42% more likely to have asthma. Ventilation and air purifiers can help but the best option is cooking electrically.

While gas is not the cleanest option, it would still be a huge improvement (for health & climate) for the millions of people currently cooking on wood or animal dung. That's why 'Clean Cooking' also made it to the list of Project Drawdown, one of our favorite resources about climate solutions.
answerExplanation.title: ü´Å

dailyContent.notificationText: What is a sustainable amount of dairy?¬†ü•õ¬†- Recipe of the day: Creamy Beetroot Rice

home.title: What is a sustainable amount of dairy?

pages.title: In a story at Muscle Mountain we already saw that a little bit of dairy can be part of a sustainable diet¬†üêÑ
The recommended amount in the EAT-Lancet report is 250 ml of whole milk equivalents¬†ü•õ
Whole milk equivalents stands for the amount of milk that went into a dairy product like cream or cheese¬†üßÄ
What is the equivalent of 250 ml of whole milk?

answerExplanation.text: 250 ml of whole milk equivalents is about one portion of any dairy product. Overall, we can say we need to bring back our dairy consumption from 2-3 portions to 1 portion per day. This recommendation is not a hard truth but a guideline.¬†

pages.subtitle: A rice recipe with (soy) cream!

pages.hometitle: Who should eat more cheese, men or women?
pages.title: The WWF used a similar approach to determine a sustainable amount of dairy. In their version, there is an interesting difference between men and women¬†üë´
Compared to men, women should eat‚Ä¶¬†üßÄ

answerExplanation.text:
In the WWF calculations, women should eat more cheese (and red meat) than men. Women get 147 g per week and men only 21 g of cheese! That‚Äôs because they have higher requirements for iron due to blood loss during menstruation.

The poster we created (see Supporter page) shows all the amounts, but we used the average for men and women.
answerExplanation.title: üßÄ

dailyContent.notificationText: What‚Äôs the impact of your favorite drink? üç∫¬†- Recipe of the day:¬†Noodles with¬†Orange¬†Juice

home.title: What‚Äôs the impact of your favorite drink?

pages.title: So far we‚Äôve mostly looked at the impact of food. But drinks also require land and have a footprint¬†üçæ
For example, to make 1 liter of beer you need around 200 grams of barley¬†üåæ¬†
During a night out, beers often go together with fast food¬†üçî¬†So how do they compare?
How many beers have the same impact as one chicken burger?¬†üç∫

answerExplanation.text:
The impact of a drink depends on our habits: the emissions of milk and coffee can really add up if you drink it every day. In that case, trying to reduce coffee or switching to plant-based milk can make a difference.

There are lots of reasons to drink less alcohol but the footprint of the occasional beer is relatively low. The snacks after a night out probably have a higher impact: one chicken burger has the same footprint as 7 beers. üçª¬†(47 in the case of beef)

pages.subtitle: In this recipe the broccoli soaks up the flavors of the orange juice. Delicious!

pages.hometitle: What characterizes the climate impact of wine and beer?
pages.title: The carbon footprint from food usually comes from growing the food¬†üåæ¬†But for beer and wine it‚Äôs different
Which part of the carbon footprint plays a relatively big role?
pages.subtitle: for wine & beer

answerExplanation.text:
Wine and beer usually come in glass, which creates higher packaging emissions. And transport emissions are high because both the glass and all the water are heavy.

But even then it‚Äôs not something to worry about too much: transporting a bottle of wine from Australia to the UK still has a lower footprint than driving a car to a local winery yourself that‚Äôs 5 km away.
answerExplanation.title: üöö

dailyContent.notificationText: Is grass-fed beef more sustainable?¬†ü•©¬†- Recipe of the day: Spinach Pesto

home.title: Is grass-fed beef more sustainable?

pages.title: Many people say that the solution for meat is eating grass-fed beef¬†ü•©
There are many reasons to feed cows grass instead of corn, but a lower climate impact is not one of them¬†üêÇ
Why does grass-fed beef not have a lower footprint?¬†ü•©

answerOptions.title: It requires more cows for the same amount of meat
Most grass-fed beef is shipped form Australia to the US/Europe

answerExplanation.text:
Cows that only eat grass are healthier, but they also grow slower. So you need more cows for the same amount of meat. And this requires extra land and causes extra methane emissions.

Beef has a high footprint because: 1) cows burp methane 2) cows require a lot of feed. Whether you get this feed from grain or grass doesn‚Äôt change the fact that it requires a lot of land, which has a high carbon cost.

There are other benefits of grazing cows but not for the climate: while cows can help grasslands to store carbon, this does not offset the extra emissions.

pages.subtitle: This pasta recipe is a great alternative to the traditional bolognese (which requires minced beef)

pages.hometitle: How heavy are today‚Äôs cows compared to the bison that used to roam the prairie?
pages.title: Sometimes people say that cows are just like bison that used to roam the prairie¬†ü¶¨
So we were curious: how much did all wild mammals weigh before humans took over the planet?¬†ü¶£
Compared to all of today‚Äôs cows, all wild mammals weighed‚Ä¶¬†ü¶£
pages.subtitle: 100.000 years ago

answerExplanation.text: All the mammoths, rhinos, bison, etc. combined still weighed 3 times less than today‚Äôs cows! Another reminder that we need to eat a lot less beef and dairy.
answerExplanation.title: ü¶£

dailyContent.notificationText: How much do you spend on food?¬†ü§ë¬†- Recipe of the day: Coconut Dahl

home.title: How much do you spend on food?

pages.title: The price of food is a topic of many conversations with the current inflation¬†üìà
So let‚Äôs take a look at how much we spend on food¬†ü§ë
How much of their income do people in the Netherlands spend on food?¬†üí∞
pages.subtitle: as percentage of household income in 2018

answerExplanation.text:
In rich Western countries we only spend around 6-12% on food. But Dutch people think it‚Äôs three times higher!

Eating sustainably is often cheaper because meat is expensive. But we also need to make farming more sustainable and fair and buying those products is often more expensive at the moment. So if you can allow it, don‚Äôt be too stingy with food.

pages.subtitle: The Fairtrade versions of products like coconut milk are an example of where spending the extra money is worth it.

pages.hometitle: Is a sustainable diet more or less expensive?
pages.title: Scientists calculated how much it would cost to switch to a sustainable & healthy diet¬†üí∞
A healthy & sustainable diet is‚Ä¶
pages.subtitle: in high-income countries

answerExplanation.text:
In high-income countries, a healthy & sustainable diet with lots of veggies and legumes and low amounts of meat & dairy is cheaper than the current diet. The model shows that eating plant-based can even reduce costs by one-third!

These diets would cost more in low-income countries, but the typical Western diet is even more expensive.
answerExplanation.title: ‚¨áÔ∏è

dailyContent.notificationText: Is honey sustainable?¬†üçØ¬†- Recipe of the day: Celeriac Sweet Potato Mash

home.title: Is honey sustainable?

pages.title: There are over 16,000 known bee species in the world but only 8 of them are considered ‚Äòhoney bees‚Äô¬†üêù
While most insects are in decline, honey bees have increased the last 50 years¬†üìà¬†What does it mean for the pollination of food?
Which bees are better at pollinating food crops?¬†

answerExplanation.text:
The reason that we have so many honey bees is because we use them as ‚Äòhoney farms‚Äô. While honey bees are really good at collecting pollen for honey, they don‚Äôt stop at other flowers to pollinate them. And if there are two bee hives in one area, there is no more food for other pollinators.

So eating honey is not helping (pollinating) insects. Instead, to increase biodiversity you can eat more organic products and keep native plants in your garden.

pages.subtitle: This recipe includes apples, a product that‚Äôs easy to buy¬†organically¬†and support more biodiversity.

pages.hometitle: Can bee hotels help to increase the number of wild bees?
pages.title: There are many different types of pollinators but bees are the most important group¬†üêù
Can bee hotels help to increase the number of wild bees?¬†üè®
The majority of bee species live‚Ä¶

answerExplanation.text:
3/4 of all bee species live underground, which means bee hotels are not the perfect home for most bees.

Still, research shows that they can help, particularly as the bee hotels get older. There were more pollinators in bee hotels that were older and when they had more flowers nearby.

But placing a few bee hotels in an area full of pavement is not going to do the job.
answerExplanation.title: üêù

dailyContent.notificationText: Can you get ‚Äòcomplete‚Äô protein from plants?¬†ü•¶¬†- Recipe of the day: Caribbean Chilli

home.title: Can you get ‚Äòcomplete‚Äô protein from plants?

pages.title: Protein consists of 20 different amino acids. We need the right mix to get ‚Äòcomplete‚Äô protein¬†üí™
Many people believe that only meat contains all essentail amino acids. This is false¬†‚ùå¬†All foods contain all amino acids, but to different levels.
So the question is: how do we make sure we get the right mix?
What is most important to get the right mix of amino acids?

answerOptions.title: Only eating certain foods in the morning
Paying attention to food combinations in one meal
Eating diverse foods during the day

answerExplanation.text:
It is false that you can only get all 20 amino acids from meat. It‚Äôs also not true that you need to eat the right combinations in one meal (e.g. rice and beans). All you need is to eat a diverse range of foods within 24 hours.

In other words, there is no need to worry about ‚Äòcomplete‚Äô protein.

pages.subtitle: One of the easiest ways to eat diverse food is making it more colorful!

pages.hometitle: Can you get enough protein from plants if you do a LOT of sports?
pages.title: Okay, so you can get ‚Äòcomplete‚Äô protein with only plants. But can you also get enough protein from plants if you do a LOT of sports?¬†üèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
The general recommended amount of protein is 0.83 g per kg bodyweight¬†‚öñÔ∏è
For what amount of the population of healthy adults should this be enough?¬†üí™

answerExplanation.text:
The European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) concludes that 0.83 g of protein per kg bodyweight is enough for virtually everyone (97.5% of healthy adults). Many people think it should be higher but the EFSA advises that the extra burnt calories simply require more food, not a focus on extra protein.

The only issue when you do a LOT of sports, like professional athletes, is that you cannot eat and digest that much, so then special solutions come in. Also good to know: they didn‚Äôt find any extra benefit for either muscle mass or performance when increasing protein intake.
answerExplanation.title: üí™

dailyContent.notificationText: How Fairtrade works¬†üë®üèæ‚Äçüåæ¬†- Recipe of the day: Banana Curry

home.title: How Fairtrade works

pages.title: We‚Äôve all heard about Fairtrade products, but what do the farmers actually get?¬†üë®üèæ‚Äçüåæ
How does Fairtrade work? üí∏

answerOptions.title: Farmers are guaranteed a minimum price
Farmers get a premium on top of their sales price

answerExplanation.text:
Many farmers around the world are small and don‚Äôt have negotiation power with big companies. That‚Äôs why the Fairtrade minimum price is an important structure.

Fairtrade also includes a premium. It‚Äôs an extra sum of money that goes into a fund. Farmers and workers can decide where it's spend and they often use it for housing, education, or improving the farm.

pages.subtitle: Bananas are an easy product to buy Fairtrade.

pages.hometitle: Do Fairtrade farmers and workers receive a ‚Äòliving wage‚Äô?
pages.title: Every person should receive a ‚Äòliving wage‚Äô: an amount of money that‚Äôs enough to have decent standard of living in their country üí∏
Fairtrade farmers and workers receive a ‚Äòliving wage‚Äô¬†üë®üèΩ‚Äçüåæ

answerExplanation.text:
Even with Fairtrade, farmers and workers do not automatically receive a living wage. This is a quote from Fairtrade itself: ‚ÄúCurrent wages are so far below living wages, that individual plantations and farmers have no way to achieve a living wage for workers and remain competitive in the market.‚Äù

So we would say Fairtrade is more like ‚Äòminimum trade‚Äô. It‚Äôs better than nothing, but still falls short. Let‚Äôs not fool ourselves: many of our products come from modern slavery and more responsible food choices aren‚Äôt going to fix it. We need better laws and a different food system.
answerExplanation.title: üí∏

dailyContent.notificationText: Does putting a lid on the pan save energy?¬†üî•¬†- Recipe of the day: Spicy Green Penne

home.title: Does putting a lid on the pan save energy?

pages.title: We already covered that the energy of cooking has a much lower climate impact than the ingredients¬†üç≥
But there are a lot of opinions about how to reduce energy use while cooking. So let‚Äôs take a closer look¬†üîé
What saves the most energy when cooking pasta?

answerOptions.title: Turning heat down after water boils and pasta is added

answerExplanation.text:
Putting the lid on traps the heat but doesn‚Äôt reduce the energy that goes into the pan. The most effective thing is to actually reduce the amount of energy.

If you‚Äôre a climate nerd you now know how to reduce cooking energy. But don‚Äôt stress too much about it: the ingredients that go into the pan are more important.

pages.subtitle: Use your new pasta knowledge with this simple and delicious recipe.

pages.hometitle: What are effective ways to reduce your gas usage?
pages.title: There are many ways to reduce the amount of gas at home üî•
What makes the SMALLEST difference?
pages.subtitle: for saving gas

answerExplanation.text:
Turning the heating down or taking shorter hot showers can make a real difference. Switching to induction doesn‚Äôt save as much gas but it does help to reduce indoor air pollution.

What we find interesting about this: habit change makes a bigger difference (for the climate and your wallet) than buying new stuff!
answerExplanation.title: üî•

dailyContent.notificationText: Sea vegetables¬†üåä¬†- Recipe of the day: Mushroom Ginger Noodle Soup

home.title: Sea vegetables

pages.title: The majority of our food comes from land but we also get some food from the Ocean. Mostly by hunting or farming fish¬†üêü
We already saw that farming mussels is much more sustainable but there is another way to farm the oceans: seaweed!¬†üåä
What is a benefit of seaweed?

answerExplanation.text:
The biggest benefit of seaweed is that we can grow vegetables without any land, fertilizer, or irrigation. Farming seaweed is also easy and cheap and most varieties are very nutritious.

Seaweed might not be a common product, but if you can find it, give this climate superfood a try!

pages.subtitle: You could add some sheets of Nori seaweed to this dish (often used for sushi).

pages.hometitle: How can seaweed capture CO2 like a forest?
pages.title: A challenge for seaweed is making it popular enough as food¬†üì£¬†But there are other options for seaweed.
One option is to use it as an alternative to planting trees to capture CO2¬†üå≥¬†But can seaweed grow fast enough?
How fast does seaweed grow?
pages.subtitle: in the case of kelp in ideal conditions

answerExplanation.text:
Planting seaweed is a great alternative to planting trees, because - again - it requires no land and fertilizer. And it can grow very fast!

Planting more seaweed is one of the climate solutions in Project Drawdown. Another one is protecting existing seaweed areas, which are currently shrinking because of human activity.
answerExplanation.title: üåä

dailyContent.notificationText: Can you afford Fairtrade & organic products? üí∞¬†- Recipe of the day: Creamy Tomato Pasta with Hazelnuts

home.title: Can you afford Fairtrade & organic products?

pages.title: In rich countries people spend around¬†8-10%¬†of their income on food. In poor countries it‚Äôs up to 50%¬†üí∞
How much did people spend on food in 1960 compared to today?
pages.subtitle: Data from the Netherlands, share of total

answerExplanation.text:
In rich countries we spend less and less on basic needs and use more of our money on luxuries. This also has a climate cost: the richer you are the higher your footprint (on average).

At the same time, many farmers are not getting paid enough. So we think it‚Äôs important to be aware of this decline in food spending. Maybe we can afford to buy more organic and Fairtrade products than we think.

pages.subtitle: Organic pasta is often not that much more expensive.

pages.hometitle: What is the cheapest way to reduce your carbon footprint?
pages.title: Some solutions like fairtrade & organic food cost money¬†üí∂¬†And while those are worth it, it‚Äôs good to remember that there are many solutions that don‚Äôt cost extra.
A study in Sweden found that the average person can reduce their footprint by 40%, without spending extra money!¬†ü§ë
Which category saved the most CO2?
pages.subtitle: both in absolute and relative terms

answerExplanation.text:
In the study they replaced flying and car travel with a train trip and a staycation with activities like concerts and a massage. All of that would cost the same but cut emissions by up to 90%.

With eating more plant-based, emissions were also cut by ca. 1/3 without spending extra. So even if you can‚Äôt afford Fairtrade and organic, your actions still make a big difference!
answerExplanation.title: ‚úàÔ∏è

dailyContent.notificationText: The most produced crop in the world¬†ü•á¬†- Recipe of the day: Chilli Spaghetti

home.title: The most produced crop in the world

pages.title: The most produced crop in the world is not wheat, corn, or rice. It‚Äôs sugarcane!¬†ü•á
It‚Äôs used for many different things, like packaging, fuel, and of course sugar. How does the climate impact of sugar compare to other foods?
Which ingredient in a chocolate cake has the highest climate impact?

answerExplanation.text: The footprint per kg of sugar is not very high. The biggest reason to be careful with sugar is still your own health.

pages.subtitle: Sometimes a little bit of sugar can make a tomato sauce more balanced. Try it with this delicious Chilli spaghetti.

pages.hometitle: How much sugar do we eat per day?
pages.title: On average, people in the Netherlands think they eat 7 cubes of sugar per day¬†üí≠
How many sugar cubes do they actually eat?¬†üç¨
pages.subtitle: in the Netherlands per person per day¬†

answerExplanation.text: People in the Netherlands eat twice as much sugar as they think! An important reason for this is that sugar is added to many products like spice mixes. Sugar also has 50 different names, like dextrose, which makes it more difficult to recognize.¬†
answerExplanation.title: üç¨
answerExplanation.sourceURL: https://www.diabetesfonds.nl/speciaal-voor/voor-de-pers/nederlanders-consumeren-meer-suiker-dan-ze-zelf-denken#:~:text=Nederlanders consumeren twee keer zoveel,is dit ruim 14 suikerklontjes.

dailyContent.notificationText: How sustainable is a BBQ?¬†üî•¬†- Recipe of the day: Low Impact BBQ

home.title: How sustainable is a¬†BBQ?

pages.title: At Fork Ranger we love a good campfire¬†üî•¬†But burning wood also causes CO2 and pollution.
The same is true for a barbecue: what‚Äôs the impact of grilling with charcoal?
What has a higher climate impact?

answerOptions.title: Charcoal for one BBQ session (1.5 kg)¬†üî•¬†

answerExplanation.text:
A barbecue burns wood (or fossil fuel) and is not really sustainable in the era of climate change, but it‚Äôs a luxury we can allow ourselves once in a while. Much more important is what we put on the BBQ.

Another important note: buy charcoal with the FSC mark for sustainable forestry.

pages.subtitle: Try some of these veggie options at your next BBQ!

pages.hometitle: Are meat alternatives a good option for BBQ?
pages.title: How acceptable people find meat alternatives can depend on the situation¬†üò∂
For example, a study found that meat alternatives feel more acceptable when eating alone than when they are invited to a restaurant¬†üë•
The acceptance of meat alternatives at a BBQ party is‚Ä¶¬†üçî
pages.subtitle: compared to other¬†dinner settings

answerExplanation.text:
Both meat eaters and flexitarians find meat alternatives less acceptable at a BBQ party than at other situations like a dinner with friends. Another good reason to put a lot of vegetables on the grill.

When it comes to hosting vegetarians and vegans at a BBQ, it often happens that the host buys meat alternatives that the guests don‚Äôt even enjoy. One effective suggestion from a study about this topic: ask the guests to bring their own favorites. This way the vegetarians will be happy and meat eaters can try some new things as well!
answerExplanation.title: üçî

dailyContent.notificationText: What is regenerative agriculture?¬†üßë‚Äçüåæ¬†- Recipe of the day: Bean Soup with Salsa

home.title: What is regenerative agriculture?

pages.title: Regenerative agriculture describes a way of farming that *improves* nature, rather than destroying it¬†üåà
But there is no official definition¬†üè≠¬†So people fear that big companies will use it for greenwashing.
One study looked at how most research and websites define regenerative agriculture¬†üîé¬†There is one outcome that was mentioned most often.
What is the most mentioned outcome of regenerative agriculture?

answerOptions.title: Taking up more CO2 in the soil¬†‚òÅÔ∏è

answerExplanation.text:
At the core of regenerative agriculture is improving the soil. This is often achieved by avoiding ‚Äòinputs‚Äô like chemical fertilizer or pesticides, making farm animals part of the system, and not tilling the land.

The easiest way to support regenerative agriculture is buying organic products, because there is a lot of overlap between these two concepts.

pages.subtitle: A delicious bean recipe. And as you know by now: beans improve the soil.

pages.hometitle: What is the main practice of regenerative agriculture?
pages.title: The biggest focus is improving soil health, but how do farmers do this?¬†üßë‚Äçüåæ
The same study also asked that question and analyzed how often certain activities are mentioned¬†üîç
Which activity is mentioned most often?
pages.subtitle: to define regenerative agriculture

answerExplanation.text:
Regenerative farms use all of these but the most mentioned activity is minimizing ‚Äòexternal inputs‚Äô like fertilizer and pesticides.

The second most-mentioned activity was combining crops and animals on the same farm. This is in contrast to the 80% of farms in the EU that are specialized in either crops or livestock.
answerExplanation.title: üß™

dailyContent.notificationText: How many people actually care about the climate?¬†üßê¬†- Recipe of the day: Lasagne with Walnuts

home.title: How many people actually care about the climate?

pages.title: For a study in the US, people were asked: How many people do you think are worried about climate change? Their answer: 43%.
Then they looked at how many people actually care¬†üßê
How many people are actually worried about climate change?
pages.subtitle: in the US

answerExplanation.text: Two-thirds of all Americans worry about climate change. But people *think* that this number is only 43%! So speak up, there are lots of people who care about the climate but stay silent. We need to support each other¬†üíö

pages.subtitle: Use this lasagne to invite friends for dinner and a talk about climate change.

pages.hometitle: How many people around the world agree that climate change is a serious threat?
pages.title: A different study surveyed 59,000 people in 63 countries and asked ‚ÄòDo you believe in climate change as a serious threat to humanity‚Äô?¬†‚ö†Ô∏è
In the country with the lowest score, how many people agreed that climate change is a serious threat?¬†‚¨áÔ∏è

answerExplanation.text:
Even in the countries with the lowest agreement, 73% agree that climate change is a problem.

The majority in every single country also supported policies like a carbon tax, expanding public transport, more renewable energy, more electric car chargers, taxes on airlines, and protecting forests.
answerExplanation.title: üí™

dailyContent.notificationText: The cost of Fairtrade¬†üí∏¬†- Recipe of the day: Spicy Greens with Peanut Sauce

home.title: The cost of Fairtrade

pages.title: When you see Fairtrade bananas right next to the cheaper bananas, it can feel like a tough choice¬†üçå
Each trip to the supermarket you feel this dilemma: good for my wallet or good for the people?¬†ü§î
But what if you make your choice for a whole year?¬†
How much extra would it cost to buy 3 Fairtrade bananas a week, for a whole year?¬†üçå
pages.subtitle: in the Netherlands

answerExplanation.text:
How do you feel about this difference? For Mareike from the Fork Ranger team this was less than she thought. And therefore she decided to buy Fairtrade bananas from now onwards.

In an ideal world, supermarkets would pay a fair price for ALL bananas. But for now, buying the Fairtrade option not only ensures a fair wage but it‚Äôs also an investment into a different food system.

pages.subtitle: You can start by making the choice to always buy the Fairtrade version of one product, like bananas, coffee, or in this case: rice.

pages.hometitle: How much would the price of meat increase with ‚Äòtrue pricing‚Äô?
pages.title: A ‚Äòtrue price‚Äô of a product not only includes the financial costs but also the societal costs that are caused by environmental damage¬†üí∞
A German study found that the true price of non-organic crops would on average get 0,79‚Ç¨ more expensive per kg¬†üåæ
How much would the price of meat increase?¬†üçó
pages.subtitle: average per kg for beef, pork, chicken¬†

answerExplanation.text:
All products - whether organic or not - get more expensive if you include the environmental damage. But the price of organic products is closer to the true price.

For vegetables, the price doesn‚Äôt increase that much but meat would be twice as expensive with a true price! The biggest price increase happens with beef, which would be 3x as expensive as current prices.
answerExplanation.title: üí∞

dailyContent.notificationText: What are the benefits of feeding cows with grass only? - Recipe of the day: Roasted Beets and Carrots

home.title: What are the benefits of feeding cows with grass only?

pages.title: Feeding cows grass instead of corn is better for the cows¬†üêÑ¬†But we‚Äôve already covered that it‚Äôs not automatically better for the climate. What about biodiversity?
There are lots of people with strong opinions about grass-fed cows but there is very little scientific research¬†ü§®
We found a paper that reviewed the impact of grass-fed dairy cows on biodiversity¬†üêù
Which description of a product is more likely to support greater biodiversity?
pages.subtitle: for dairy products

answerExplanation.text:
The problem with grass-fed products is that it can still come from grass monocultures sprayed with chemical fertilizer.

Organic is not only about avoiding pesticides and chemical fertilizer, but also has lots of other requirements, like that animals must be outside part of the time. All of this means organic meat and dairy are better for biodiversity. But only if we also reduce the amounts we eat.

Of course when it comes to increasing biodiversity, there is also the option to have no cows at all.

pages.subtitle: We can also eat grass ourselves, or at least the seeds. Wheat is a type of grass and this recipe includes wheat in the form of bulgur.

pages.hometitle: How much soy and corn do organic cows eat?
pages.title: Dairy cows not only eat grass but also corn and ‚Äòconcentrate‚Äô like soy¬†üåΩ¬†A Spanish study compared the diets of different farming methods.
How much concentrate and corn do organic cows eat?¬†üêÑ
pages.subtitle: compared to conventional cows

answerExplanation.text:
Organic cows also eat maize and power food, but at lower levels. The irony is that the Spanish study describes this as a problem because the organic cows give less milk.

This illustrates that only switching to organic meat & dairy is not the solution. If we switch to organic we need more cows and more land.

That's why we need to eat less of these products. But for the small amounts we do eat, it makes sense to have them organic.
answerExplanation.title: üåΩ

dailyContent.notificationText: The climate impact of your oven¬†üî•¬†- Recipe of the day: Roasted Brussel Sprouts and Cauliflower

home.title: The climate impact of your oven

pages.title: We‚Äôve already covered the energy use of induction vs. gas. But what about the oven?¬†‚ô®Ô∏è
Let‚Äòs say you‚Äòre roasting potatoes for 30 minutes instead of frying them in the pan¬†ü•î
How much higher is the climate impact of the oven?
pages.subtitle: compared to frying potatoes in the pan

answerExplanation.text: Maybe we shouldn‚Äôt use the oven every day but clearly it‚Äôs more important to focus on the impact of the ingredients. Especially since in a few years, all electricity will be renewable¬†üòé

pages.subtitle: Roasting veggies in the oven is one of the easiest ways to create a lot of flavor.

pages.hometitle: What‚Äôs the most effective way to reduce the energy use of the oven?
pages.title: The oven uses a lot of energy but are there ways we can reduce it?¬†‚ö°Ô∏è
Which of these is the best strategy to save energy? ‚ö°Ô∏è

answerOptions.title: Turning it off 5-10 minutes before the end

answerExplanation.text:
You can turn the oven off 5-10 minutes before the end of the cooking time and let the food finish in the hot oven. This works well for our recipes but don‚Äôt use it for baking because that requires more precision.

Pre-heating the oven can be important for the flavor, as the immediate heat creates a different effect than gradual warming. For example, pre-heating is necessary to get crispy potatoes.
answerExplanation.title: ‚ö°Ô∏è

dailyContent.notificationText: Is hunting sustainable?¬†üèπ¬†- Recipe of the day: Spinach Potato Curry

home.title: Is hunting sustainable?

pages.title: We‚Äôve learned a lot about farm animals. It‚Äôs time to look at wild animals¬†üêó
Let‚Äôs explore two areas in the Netherlands with deer: in one of them, no hunting is allowed¬†ü¶å
And in the other area, they shoot deer so there aren‚Äôt too many of them¬†üèπ
What happened to the area where they shot deer?

answerExplanation.text:
A lot of our nature is out of balance: there are no predators and because of streets and cities, deer can‚Äôt migrate to other areas. Then they crowd out other animals and plants.

Shooting them is one solution, and the majority of hunting in the Netherlands happens for this reason. So this can be a form of sustainable meat, but there is not enough to replace our current meat consumption.

Also when it comes to wild meat, keep in mind that the situation (and therefore sustainability) differs a lot from region to region and for different animal types. This is just one example.

pages.subtitle: To be honest, this curry has nothing to do with hunting. But it‚Äôs easy and delicious.¬†

pages.hometitle: Is wild meat really wild?
pages.title: Some of the meat that we think of as ‚Äòwild‚Äô is actually farmed¬†üöú
Which of these is always wild?
pages.subtitle: in the Netherlands

answerExplanation.text:
In the Netherlands, meat from duck and rabbit is often farmed. And when it comes to deer it depends on the species.

Fallow deer have white spots on them and often come from a farm (you also see them in city parks). Roe deer are smaller and browner. They don‚Äôt eat grass and are considered more nervous and solitary. That's why you can't farm them, and it's always wild meat if you see it on a menu.
answerExplanation.title: ü¶å

dailyContent.notificationText: The impact of cultivated meat¬†üçñ¬†- Recipe of the day: Balsamic Broccoli Noodles

home.title: The impact of cultivated meat

pages.title: Besides making meat plant-based, there are also initiatives to grow meat without animals üß´
It works by taking cells from an animal and then growing those into meat¬†üçñ
Right now cultivated meat is still very expensive¬†üí∞¬†And the carbon footprint ranges from very low to much higher than beef.
What determines the carbon footprint of cultivated meat?

answerOptions.title: Type of animal the cells come from¬†üêÑ
How much of the energy is renewable ‚ö°Ô∏è

answerExplanation.text:
Cultivated meat is not yet widely available, apart from a handful of high-end restaurants. So a study estimated the carbon footprint of cultivated meat in 2030.

The impact was determined by the energy mix: when all energy is renewable, the impact is expected to be comparable to plant-based meat. But with the expected energy mix of 2030, the impact is higher than pork and chicken.

pages.subtitle: This recipe includes tofu, which has roughly the same footprint as the best-case scenario for cultivated meat.

pages.hometitle: Does cultivated meat taste exactly the same?
pages.title: In 2022, an Israeli startup served a piece of cultivated chicken to professional taster Michal Ansky¬†üçó
They did a blind tasting with real chicken and ground up both versions so there wouldn‚Äôt be a difference in texture.
Did she taste a difference?¬†üëÖ

answerExplanation.text: It was a blind tasting and she was convinced that the cultivated chicken was the real one. This story shows the potential of the solution. But for now, there remain a lot of challenges around costs and scaling up production.
answerExplanation.title: üçó

dailyContent.notificationText: What‚Äôs the most sustainable coffee? ‚òïÔ∏è - Recipe of the day: Chickpea and Lemon Wraps

home.title: What‚Äôs the most sustainable coffee?

pages.title: There are lots of different ways to prepare a cup of coffee ‚òïÔ∏è
They all have a unique taste, but do they also differ in their carbon footprint?
Which method of making coffee has the highest footprint? ‚òïÔ∏è

answerExplanation.text:
An espresso has the lowest footprint but it‚Äôs also just 40 ml. French press also has a low footprint because it doesn‚Äôt use much electricy or create waste (it also contains the most caffeine).

More important than how you make your coffee is the coffee you buy: the espresso would have a much higher impact if we use the average coffee numbers from a big study that reviewed multiple coffees. The most sustainable coffee comes from agroforestry (see the infographic in ‚ÄòFading Forest‚Äô).

pages.subtitle: Agroforestry is about mixing agriculture with trees. This recipe includes walnuts, which of course comes from trees and can also be grown in agroforestry systems.

pages.hometitle: Is a reusable cup more sustainable than paper cups?
pages.title: Coffee-to-go comes in paper cups. But it‚Äôs not really paper because the inside is lined with plastic¬†ü•§
Let‚Äôs say you buy one coffee to-go every day and you switch to a reusable cup ‚òïÔ∏è
How long would it take to save emissions?¬†‚è±

answerExplanation.text:
After around 20-40 times a reusable cup saves more CO2 than getting paper cups. So if you‚Äôre someone who drinks a lot of coffee on the go, this is a good investment.

But if you only buy a coffee-to-go a few times a year you don‚Äôt have to stress about it too much.
answerExplanation.title: ‚òïÔ∏è

home.title: How much does our food contribute to climate change?

pages.title: How much does our food contribute to climate change?
pages.subtitle: yearly greenhouse gas emissions worldwide

answerExplanation.text:
Our global food system causes one third of all emissions. 

On your Fork Ranger journey you‚Äôre going to explore the most important sources of these emissions and what we can do about it.

pages.subtitle: This was the first Fork Ranger recipe and it has become a favorite of dozens of people.

home.title: What can save more CO2 emissions?

pages.title: What can save more CO2 emissions?

answerExplanation.text:
The most effective way to reduce the footprint of our food is eating less meat and dairy.

You don‚Äôt have to become a vegetarian to be part of the solution. A few simple changes can make a massive difference.

pages.subtitle: Most of us need to eat more veggies and this recipe makes that a lot easier.

home.title: The most effective solutions for climate change

pages.title: Which solution can save the most CO2?

answerExplanation.text:
At Fork Ranger, we are inspired by the fact that there are some very human solutions that can save a lot more CO2 than technology.

It‚Äôs all about finding a new way of living that is in harmony with nature:
- less meat, more plants
- less flying, more local adventures
- less stuff, more memories

pages.subtitle: One of our most simple recipes. So it‚Äôs to also set a small step on busy days.
